page.title: 20Dagoes, Work
page.content:
Local people called these squatters "Dagoes".Every so often the police warned the squatters that their shacks would be burnt down for fear of disease.After a week they would return and rebuild them.
WORK There were three bakeries.My parents owned the one in Ashfield road.Bread had to be fresh for the boxes of the miners who worked at the Celynen North ,South and Navigation pit at Crumlin and for those who worked at the mining levels at Treowen and Penar.There used is be a slaughter house in Riverside terrace (now a garage),where pigs, sheep+cows were slaughtered and the freshmeat was then delivered to butchers shops in the area.... THERE IS A BIG DIFFERENCE BETWEEN NEWBRIDGE THEN AND NOW.........
